# Likelihood { #bambi.Likelihood }

```python
Likelihood(name, params=None, parent=None, dist=None)
```

Representation of a Likelihood function for a Bambi model

## Parameters {.doc-section .doc-section-parameters}

<code>[**name**]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [[str](`str`)]{.parameter-annotation}</code>

:   Name of the likelihood function. Must be a valid PyMC distribution name.

<code>[**params**]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [sequence of str or None]{.parameter-annotation} [ = ]{.parameter-default-sep} [None]{.parameter-default}</code>

:   The name of the parameters the likelihood function accepts.

<code>[**parent**]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [[str](`str`) or None]{.parameter-annotation} [ = ]{.parameter-default-sep} [None]{.parameter-default}</code>

:   Optional specification of the name of the mean parameter in the likelihood. This is the parameter whose transformation is modeled by the linear predictor.

<code>[**dist**]{.parameter-name} [:]{.parameter-annotation-sep} [[pymc](`pymc`).[Distribution](`pymc.Distribution`) or [callable](`callable`) or None]{.parameter-annotation} [ = ]{.parameter-default-sep} [None]{.parameter-default}</code>

:   Optional custom PyMC distribution that will be used to compute the likelihood.

## Notes {.doc-section .doc-section-notes}

- `parent` must be in `params`
- `parent` is inferred from the `name` if it is a known name
